abstract: Tradition of planting cover crops, vegetation whose only value is to improve soil, enjoys resurgence as more commercial farm operators see significant economic upside to abandoning contemporary reliance on chemicals; method's growing popularity is propagating new seed, food and beverage industries.

headline.print_headline: A Revolution With Deep Roots in the Past
headline.main: Cover Crops, a Farming Revolution With Deep Roots in the Past

snippet: The practice of seeding fields between harvests with noncash crops, which had fallen out of favor at modern farms, is making a steady comeback as farmers who have embraced it report higher yields.
lead_paragraph: The practice of seeding fields between harvests with noncash crops, which had fallen out of favor at modern farms, is making a steady comeback as farmers who have embraced it report higher yields.
